qas.question: What early team copied the Arsenal's red current color in 1909?
What team in 1938 used the same style of kit, but in green?
By coping the Arsenal team kit exactly, what nickname was given to Sporting Clube de Braga?
For how long have the Arsenal inspired copy-cat clubs worn their uniforms?
What was Sporting Clube de Braga's original color?
In what stadium does Sparta Prague play?
What's the nickname of Sparta Prague?
What color kit did Sparta Prague wear in 1908?
What color are Sparta Prague's sleeves?
Who won the 1920 game between Arsenal and Sporting Clube de Braga that took place at Highbury?

context: <b9_0>Arsenal<b9_0/>'s home colours have been the inspiration for at least three other clubs. In 1909, <a0_0>Sparta Prague<a0_0/> adopted a <b8_0>dark red<b8_0/> kit like the one Arsenal wore at the time; in 1938, <a1_0>Hibernian<a1_0/> adopted the design of the Arsenal shirt sleeves in their own green and white strip. In 1920, Sporting Clube de Braga's manager returned from a game at <b5_0>Highbury<b5_0/> and changed his team's <a4_0><b7_0>green<b7_0/><a4_0/> kit to a duplicate of Arsenal's red with white sleeves and shorts, giving rise to the team's nickname of <a2_0><b6_0>Os Arsenalistas<b6_0/><a2_0/>. These teams still wear those designs <a3_0>to this day<a3_0/>.
